text: Lawrence Wosskow (born July 5, 1963) is a serial entrepreneur, who previously owned a number of UK companies, including Little Chef, a chain of 230 roadside restaurants; Out of Town Restaurants Group, the UK's largest shopping center caterer, known for changing the eating habits of millions of British shoppers; Free Spirit, a chain of surf/outdoor retail stores; and the ice cream brands Loseley and Bradwells. After retiring in 2006 due to ill health, Wosskow took a break from business. In 2009, he began investing in UK commercial properties, most notably redeveloping Harrogate’s city center. Currently based in the Bahamas, Wosskow is actively investing in new businesses. Wosskow's book, Little Chef, the Heart of the Deal, a U.K. Best Seller, was released on November 28, 2017. ==References== == External links == * Little Chef, the Heart of the Deal website Category:British chief executives Category:Leaders of organizations Category:1963 births Category:Living people
